Greatest Kadamba Ruler

The most powerful and famous king of the Kadamba dynasty. His reign is considered the golden age of the Kadambas.

ЁЯТН
Matrimonial Diplomacy

He married his daughters into prominent dynasties: the Guptas (possibly Kumaragupta I or Skandagupta), the Vakatakas (Narendrasena), and the Alupas.

ЁЯУМ
Important Facts (Exam Points)
  • Halmidi Inscription (c. 450 CE): The oldest known inscription in the Kannada language (from the time of his descendant, but showing Kadamba influence).
  • Talagunda Inscription: Erected by his son Shantivarman in his honor.
